tidbits.title: Saharan Nation
tidbits.description: Mauritania is a Saharan nation known for vast desert landscapes, including the UNESCO-listed Banc d'Arguin National Park.

tidbits.title: Rich Nomadic Heritage
tidbits.description: The country has a rich nomadic heritage, and traditional Moorish culture is reflected in art, music, and tea-drinking ceremonies.

tidbits.title: Slavery Abolition
tidbits.description: Mauritania was one of the last countries to abolish slavery in 1981 and criminalized it in 2007, but challenges persist in enforcement.
